title: â€˜Papa, main chaurahe par thaâ€™: Was there a seat swap after Thar killed elderly tourist in Goa?
content: A 65-year-old tourist from Bhopal died after his car was hit by a speeding SUV at the Happy Bar junction in Assagao. Eyewitnesses allege occupants of the rented SUV attempted to switch seats after the collision. Police are investigating the incident, verifying claims of a driver cover-up.

title: 'Puppet of foreign powers': BJP labels Rahul, Gandhi clan & Congress 'compromised'
content: Putting all the members of the Gandhi family, who have ruled the nation, in the dock, the Union minister said the clan never "shied away from compromising the country". He went further back to attack the Nehru-Gandhi family as he highlighted the infamous Bofors scandal that was widely reported during Rajiv Gandhi's tenure and had been the reason behind the fall of his government.

title: â€˜Huge mistakeâ€™: Bill Gates admits having affairs with Russian women
content: Bill Gates has apologised to Gates Foundation staff for his association with Jeffrey Epstein, admitting it was a "huge mistake" that harmed the organisation's reputation. While asserting he "did nothing illicit," Gates acknowledged meetings continued after Epstein's conviction and that his ties helped Epstein "burnish his reputation." He also admitted to two affairs during his marriage.

title: Rinku Singh to rejoin India squad ahead of must-win clash vs Zimbabwe
content: Rinku Singh is set to rejoin the Indian squad this evening after a brief absence due to his father's ill health. The middle-order batter had returned home urgently, missing training sessions. His father is reportedly in serious condition in an NCR hospital. Singh's availability for the crucial Super 8 match against Zimbabwe was in doubt following his departure.

title: Pentagon head Pete Hegseth gives an ultimatum to Anthropic CEO Dario Amodei
content: The Pentagon has issued an ultimatum to AI firm Anthropic, demanding it drop its safety rules by Friday or face severe retaliation, including potential use of the Defense Production Act. Anthropic's refusal to allow its AI for mass surveillance or autonomous weapons has caused a major rift with the Defense Secretary.

title: Catch a falling diamond! Indians wants solitaires as price falls by 30%
content: Diamond prices have dropped significantly, making solitaires more affordable and boosting demand among consumers aged 28-40. This trend, driven by improved affordability and a shift towards investment purchases, has led to a 25% year-on-year sales surge in the solitaire segment. Younger buyers are increasingly opting for diamond-studded jewelry over gold due to high gold prices.

title: IndiGo chaos: Over 200 passengers made to wait 5 hours inside flight at Chennai airport
content: Over 200 IndiGo passengers faced a grueling 5-hour delay for their Singapore-bound flight from Chennai due to a cabin temperature issue and crew duty hour limitations. Passengers reported suffocation and lack of clear communication, with a viral video capturing their distress. An alternate crew was arranged, leading to the significant delay.

title: Sam Altman at IIT-Delhi: 'Traditional career advice wonâ€™t work in the AI era'
content: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman advised young Indians against solely relying on traditional career advice, emphasizing the need to develop and trust their own intuition in the rapidly changing AI era. He acknowledged that while some jobs will disappear, new ones will emerge, urging a balanced perspective on AI's impact and encouraging calculated risk-taking for future success.

title: CCTV captures speeding Ferrari crashing into vehicles in Hyderabad's Jubilee Hills
content: A speeding Ferrari crashed into multiple vehicles in Jubilee Hills after allegedly suffering a mechanical failure, injuring five people. CCTV footage captured the luxury sports car swerving out of control, hitting an electric pole before colliding head-on with oncoming traffic. Police are investigating the incident, focusing on both driving conditions and suspected mechanical defects.

title: Ranji final explodes: J&K captain Paras Dogra headbutts Karnataka fielder â€” watch
content: Jammu and Kashmir captain Paras Dogra headbutted a Karnataka substitute fielder during the Ranji Trophy final, sparking heated exchanges. Despite the incident and subsequent confrontations, Jammu and Kashmir continued to dominate, building on a strong first innings performance.

title: Murder accused out on bail dragged, stabbed and shot multiple times in Greater Noida
content: A 30-year-old man, Nitin Nagar, the main accused in a 2024 murder case and out on bail, was brutally attacked and killed by four men in Greater Noida. Dragged, stabbed, and shot multiple times in front of his wife, Nagar's death is suspected to be a gang war retaliation.

title: 'Out of love, not lust': U'khand HC on why it ended proceedings in POCSO case
content: The Uttarakhand High Court quashed POCSO proceedings against a 21-year-old man after he lawfully married the 17-year-old victim. The court cited their peaceful cohabitation and the woman's pregnancy, deeming continuation of the case a denial of justice. This decision emphasizes compassion and practicality in specific post-marriage scenarios.

title: Madhya Pradesh shocker: Minor delivers baby while writing Class 10 board exam
content: A Class 10 student in Madhya Pradesh's Dhar district gave birth in an examination centre's washroom during her Mathematics board paper. She experienced severe stomach pain and delivered a baby boy after writing for two hours. Both mother and child are reported to be stable.

title: Venezuela chartering large crude carriers to boost export to India
content: Large vehicles, each capable of carrying as much as 2 million barrels of crude, are likely to reduce freight costs for traders and buyers, ease the shortage of smaller vessels and quicken deliveries from next month.

title: 'Instant idli-sambar': Dhinakaran mocks aunt Sasikala's new political party
content: TTV Dhinakaran has mocked VK Sasikala's new political party launch. He compared it to instant food and stated it will not impact the NDA's chances in the upcoming Tamil Nadu Assembly elections. Sasikala announced her return to politics and the formation of a new Dravidian party. Dhinakaran asserted that true followers of Jayalalithaa remain united.

title: Gold price today: Check rates of 18K, 22K, 24K gold in your city
content: Gold futures surged by Rs 1,322 to Rs 1,61,291 per 10 grams on Wednesday, fueled by fresh speculator buying and strong physical market demand. Overseas markets also saw gold prices climb. The article details current gold rates per gram for 24K, 22K, and 18K in major Indian cities.

title: Delhi HC observes breakup may not amount to abetment of suicide
content: A Delhi court granted bail to a man accused of abetting his former partner's suicide, stating a breakup alone isn't criminal instigation. The court noted a significant gap between the couple's last contact and the woman's death, suggesting her suicide might stem from personal reasons rather than direct provocation. The trial will determine the true cause.

title: Big cat on campus! Exams postponed after leopard enters Ghaziabad school â€” watch
content: A leopard's intrusion into Greenfield School in Ghaziabad on Wednesday caused exam postponements and widespread alarm, captured on CCTV. The Forest Department has deployed a trap at the school boundary, with ongoing efforts to safely capture the animal without tranquilization.

title: Highway crash in Maharashtra: Car carrying liquor flips several times, driver dies
content: A car accident on the Dhule-Surat highway tragically claimed the life of a 29-year-old driver. The vehicle overturned multiple times, leaving his companion critically injured. Authorities discovered several boxes of country-made liquor inside the car without proper permits. Legal action was initiated against the driver for rash and dangerous driving, with further charges pending following his death.

title: Delhi police head constable kills ED staffer with licensed pistol at wedding
content: A Delhi Police head constable has been arrested for allegedly shooting dead a 30-year-old Enforcement Department staffer at a wedding in Wazirabad. The victim was allegedly targeted by the constable due to a prior dispute. Two relatives of the accused have also been apprehended.

title: Kannada actor Rajkumar abduction: Madras HC upholds acquittal of 9 Veerappan aides
content: The Madras High Court has dismissed the Tamil Nadu government's appeal against the acquittal of nine aides of forest brigand Veerappan in the 2000 Kannada actor Rajkumar abduction case. A trial court had acquitted the surviving nine accused in September 2018, a decision now upheld by the High Court after a five-year appeal process.

title: Chinese dance troupeâ€™s tour triggers bomb threat at Australian PM's residence
content: Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese was evacuated from his residence following a bomb threat linked to Shen Yun performances. Emails warned of explosives if shows proceeded, threatening the Prime Minister's Lodge. Shen Yun confirmed they would continue their Australian tour and called for an investigation. This incident follows similar threats targeting the group globally.

title: Assam woman dragged out of car, gang-raped in front of fiance
content: A 28-year-old woman was allegedly gang-raped on the Ramnagar bypass road in Silchar after her fiancÃ© was restrained by a group of youths. The incident occurred on February 19, with police registering a case under multiple sections of the Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita. One accused has been arrested, and efforts are underway to apprehend others.

title: Los Angeles Lakers predicted to trade for $131 mn Cleveland Cavaliers superstar to bolster roster
content: Los Angeles Lakers are reportedly eyeing Cleveland Cavaliers' Jarrett Allen before the 2026 trade deadline. The proposed deal involves sending Austin Reaves and future draft picks to Cleveland. This move aims to bolster the Lakers' frontcourt with much-needed size and defense, while the Cavaliers could gain scoring and guard play.

title: T20 WC: Shoaib Akhtarâ€™s meltdown after Pakistan loss goes viral - watch
content: Shoaib Akhtar expressed intense disappointment following Pakistan's T20 World Cup defeat to England, criticizing captain Salman Ali Agha's leadership.  England's victory, spearheaded by Harry Brook's century, shattered Pakistan's semi-final aspirations, leaving their tournament hopes dependent on other match outcomes.

title: 'We are ashamed': Harsh Singh apologises over racial slurs at 3 Arunachal women in Delhi
content: Harsh Singh apologized after allegations of racial slurs and intimidation against three women from Arunachal Pradesh. The incident, stemming from a dispute over repair work, led to Singh's wife Ruby Jain's arrest. Singh expressed shame and requested a fair investigation, stating the confrontation occurred in the heat of the moment.

title: US announces duties on Indian solar imports; stocks of Waaree Energies, Premier drop 15%
content: Indian solar equipment manufacturers experienced a sharp decline in share prices following the US announcement of countervailing duties on imports from India, Indonesia, and Laos. The US Commerce Department cited government subsidies in these nations as disadvantaging American producers. This move, impacting a significant portion of US solar imports, follows previous disruptions caused by similar tariffs on other Asian countries.

title: Former Jharkhand CM Champai Soren's grandson dies under mysterious circumstances
content: Veer Soren, grandson of former Jharkhand CM Champai Soren, died in Manali under mysterious circumstances. He was found unconscious with foam around his mouth by friends at their homestay. Doctors declared him dead after attempts to revive him failed. High altitude sickness is a suspected cause pending the postmortem report.

title: 'How did that go for them?' Trump taunts Russian, Chinese defences in Venezuela
content: US forces, in a swift operation, captured Venezuelan President Maduro and his wife, showcasing American military might. President Trump highlighted the failure of Russian and Chinese defense technology to prevent the capture, asserting a significant victory for US security and a new dawn for Venezuela. The operation involved advanced US capabilities, overwhelming Venezuelan defenses.

title: â€˜Whoâ€™s your best XI?â€™: Ricky Ponting warns India to return to â€˜basicsâ€™ or risk T20 World Cup exit
content: Former Australia captain Ricky Ponting urged India to abandon overthinking match-ups and select their best XI to revive their T20 World Cup campaign. Following a significant defeat, Ponting emphasised prioritising team balance and experience, advocating for the return of Kuldeep Yadav and Axar Patel to bolster bowling options.

title: Is Mexico safe for football fans amid cartel violence? FIFA monitors security
content: Mexico's upcoming major football tournaments face scrutiny due to recent cartel violence. Despite assurances from officials like Claudia Sheinbaum and FIFA, security concerns persist for fans. Authorities are enhancing measures in host cities, but travelers are advised to follow safety guidelines amid ongoing regional instability and transportation disruptions.

title: What's happening in the IDFC First Bank Rs 590 crore scam case? Top developments
content: Haryana's State Vigilance and Anti-Corruption Bureau has arrested four individuals, including two former IDFC First Bank employees and two private partners, in connection with a Rs 590 crore fraud. The bank disclosed the fraud involving its employees and external parties in accounts linked to the Haryana government.

title: Gold price prediction: Will gold, silver be able to hold on to gains this week?
content: Gold price prediction today: Gold prices are moving up but the lack of any major positive catalyst may limit the upside this week, says Maneesh Sharma, AVP - Commodities & Currencies, Anand Rathi Shares and Stock Brokers.

title: 1 hour, 48 minutes: Trump overtakes Bill Clinton to deliver longest speech
content: US President Donald Trump delivered the longest State of the Union address on record, clocking in at nearly 1 hour and 48 minutes.  He highlighted his immigration policies and defended tariffs, drawing mixed reactions from lawmakers.  This lengthy speech continues a trend of modern presidents delivering more extended addresses compared to earlier eras.

title: Delhi court directs cricketer Shikhar Dhawanâ€™s ex-wife to return Rs 5.7cr
content: An Indian court has ruled that Australian family court orders regarding property settlements are unenforceable in India. The judge stated that the concept of "property settlement" under Australian law is alien to Indian matrimonial law. Consequently, Shikhar Dhawan's former wife was ordered to return Rs 5.7 crore and cannot claim Rs 16.9 crore awarded by the Australian court.

title: Thar falls into 100-feet-deep ravine while performing 'stunts' in Faridabad; Class 9 student dies
content: A 15-year-old boy died and two friends were critically injured when their Thar SUV plunged 50 feet into a gorge in Faridabad's Aravalli hills. The group was filming a stunt video when the vehicle reversed and fell. Locals rescued the injured before police arrived.

title: 'Deenbandhu shot me': 18-year-old bride shot on wedding stage in Bihar
content: An 18-year-old bride was shot during her varmala ceremony in Buxar district by a masked assailant. The victim, Aarti Kumari, identified her alleged attacker as a neighbor with whom she had a one-sided relationship. She is currently on a ventilator in critical condition in Varanasi.

title: Noel Tata lists out criteria on which Chandra must deliver
content: Tata Sons' board is re-evaluating Chairman Chandrasekaran's reappointment, with Noel Tata outlining performance criteria.  Concerns over losses in aviation and digital, capital expenditure in new ventures, and maintaining the unlisted status are key.  This comes after significant group setbacks and a market cap decline, prompting a closer look at leadership continuity.

title: Delhi to be renamed Indraprastha? BJP MP writes to Amit Shah after Kerala's name change
content: A BJP MP has proposed renaming Delhi to Indraprastha. He believes this name connects the capital to its ancient past. The MP cited historical evidence linking Delhi to the Mahabharata. He also suggested renaming key transport hubs. This move aims to reconnect with India's roots and foster cultural revival. The proposal follows the recent approval to rename Kerala as Keralam.

title: 'Will not allow anybody to defame SC': CJI pulls up NCERT over text on judicial corruption
content: The Supreme Court has taken serious note of a Class 8 NCERT textbook referencing corruption in the judiciary. Chief Justice of India Surya Kant expressed strong disapproval, calling it a potential conspiracy to defame the institution.  The textbook's inclusion of this sensitive topic, while omitting similar issues in other sectors, has raised concerns among legal figures and judges.

title: Kiper's latest NFL mock draft: Projecting the entire first round ahead of the combine
content: As the NFL gets ready for this week's combine workouts, let's project where the best players in the 2026 draft class will get picked in April.

title: Source: Kyler hasn't talked to Cards, refuting GM
content: Cardinals general manager Monti Ossenfort said he has spoken with quarterback Kyler Murray, but a source told ESPN that the two have not talked since the end of the season.

title: Boozer goes off as Duke beats Notre Dame by 44
content: Cameron Boozer had 24 points and 13 rebounds as No. 1 Duke beat Notre Dame 100-56 on Tuesday night, handing the Irish their worst home loss since 1898.

title: Sources: Aubrey pushes for bigger Cowboys offer
content: The Cowboys have extended an offer to Brandon Aubrey that would make him the highest-paid kicker in the NFL, sources told ESPN, but Aubrey's agent has asked for a deal closer to $10 million per season.

title: Hellebuyck set for Medal of Freedom, Trump says
content: Connor Hellebuyck, the goaltender for the gold-medal-winning U.S. men's Olympic hockey team, will be awarded the Presidential Medal of Freedom, President Donald Trump announced during Tuesday night's State of the Union.

title: Lynch believes 49ers, Williams 'on the same page'
content: Shortly after ESPN's Adam Schefter reported Tuesday that left tackle Trent Williams and the 49ers are "struggling to find a contractual solution," general manager John Lynch offered a more optimistic perspective.

title: Botched final play sees Luka hesitate, LeBron miss
content: The Lakers lost to the Magic 110-109 on Tuesday after a botched sidelines out-of-bounds play between LeBron James and Luka Doncic in the final seconds failed to produce a quality shot.

title: Virginia QB Morris files lawsuit seeking 7th year
content: Virginia quarterback Chandler Morris has filed a lawsuit against the NCAA seeking a seventh year of eligibility.

title: Pirates' Griffin, MLB's top prospect, wows with HRs
content: Konnor Griffin, the Pirates' 19-year-old shortstop and the consensus No. 1 prospect in baseball, hit home runs off Red Sox pitchers Ranger Suarez and Seth Martinez.

content: In a time of transition for USA basketball, here's what the 12-man squad that will go up against a competitive international slate could look like.

content: Enjoy all that happened from today's UEFA Champions League matches, including BodÃ¸/Glimt's historic win over Inter to advance to the round of 16.

content: Olney's ranking of the top players at every position continues with the premier infield position: shortstop. Find out who comes out on top of this star-studded field.

content: From metrics to star injuries and Charles Bediako, the key discussion points that could define March Madness.

content: The Tigers have lost six of seven games to fall into the ninth position of a projected 10- to 11-bid conference.

content: The projected No. 1 NBA draft pick has sat out enough games to cast uncertainty on his team's potential in March.

content: At the 2002 Survivor Series, six WWE superstars entered the Elimination Chamber. We look back at that night.

content: Andreas Hale answers questions about the rematch and explains how the matchup looks 11 years after their first encounter.

content: With all the focus on the portal, we look at the most important players retained across college football.

content: The slew of high-priced players who joined the Premier League in the summer transfer window haven't exactly been on fire. Why the slow starts?

title: Back at the BernabÃ©u: Could Mourinho return to coach Real Madrid again?
content: Wednesday's clash isn't just a chance for JosÃ© Mourinho's Benfica to eliminate Real Madrid from the Champions League. It might also be an audition.

title: MLS Power Rankings: LAFC lead the way after win over champs Miami and Lionel Messi
content: LAFC get a convincing win over defending champions Inter Miami to kick off the 2026 MLS season and the latest ESPN Power Rankings.

title: Boxing divisional rankings: Ryan Garcia enters welterweight top five
content: A masterful title fight performance from Garcia earns him a WBC belt and a spot among the welterweight elite.

title: 'Got to be careful around Mario': Kirby Smart, Mario Cristobal trade joking barbs at Steve Spurrier Awards
content: At the 2026 Steve Spurrier Awards dinner -- named for a coach known for his wit -- Mario Cristobal and Kirby Smart fittingly traded jokes on Monday night.

title: As NIL cash grows, coaches call for rules to protect athletes from 'street agents'
content: Coaches and other observers see a growing need to protect athletes by regulating middlemen in NIL deals.

title: Dreams on paper, gold on ice: Revisiting Jack Hughes' and Alysa Liu's 2019 letters
content: In 2019, Hughes and Liu wrote to their retired selves. In 2026, they added Olympic gold to the story.

content: Nine tips to use during the fantasy baseball season, from trade strategies to how to value rookies and closers

content: Every week in fantasy basketball, there are available players who can help fill holes in your roster. Here are the ones to add for the week ahead.

title: 'Killed For Rs 20,000, ISI Behind It': Punjab Police On Cops' Killing
content: The killing of the two policemen near the India and Pakistan border in Punjab's Gurdaspur was carried out by Pakistan's Inter-Services Intelligence (ISI), a senior police official said Wednesday.

title: Inside Mumbai's Worsening Air Pollution Crisis
content: Mumbai woke up to yet another blanket of haze on Tuesday morning, with a grey veil hanging over the skyline from Bandra to South Mumbai.

title: India Is Israel's Largest Arms Buyer, Their Defence Partnership In Numbers
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi's visit to Israel on February 25-26, 2026, comes at a moment when defence ties between the two countries are more consequential than ever.

title: PM Modi Israel visit LIVE: PM Modi To Become 1st Indian PM To Address Israeli Parliament
content: Narendra Modi Israel Visit LIVE: Prime Minister Narendra Modi is travelling to Israel on a two-day high-profile visit on Wednesday, marking his second trip to Tel Aviv after the historic 2017 visit.

title: How An Ex Branch Manager Masterminded 590-Crore Fraud At IDFC FIRST Bank
content: Behind the Rs 590-crore fraud at IDFC FIRST Bank's Chandigarh branch was a former branch manager, and funds from Haryana government departments' accounts were funnelled into an account belonging to a company run by the former manager's wife

title: "Would've Cremated Him Alone": Lucknow Man Who Murdered Father To Cops
content: Akshat shot his father, Manvendra Singh, in a fit of rage during a fight in the early hours of February 20, chopped his body into pieces and disposed it off.

title: Housekeeping Staff Pose As "GST Officers", Scam Bengaluru Traders
content: Two housekeeping employees, working at a Central Government GST office, posed as "Intelligence Officers" and ran an extortion racket targeting city traders before being caught in Bengaluru.

title: Pakistan's 'Muslim Ummah' Concern Over Israel's 'Hexagon Alliance' Plan With India
content: Pakistan is rattled by Israeli PM Benjamin Netanyahu's pitch for a "hexagon of alliances" with India, with Islamabad calling it an "anti-Muslim Ummah bloc."

title: "Did Nothing Illicit": Bill Gates On 'Sex With Russian Girls' Claim In Epstein Files
content: Bill Gates told staff that he began meeting Epstein in 2011 and was aware of his legal trouble that restricted his travel, but admitted that he did not conduct a thorough background check at the time.

title: Russian Soldiers Allege Torture, Execution For Refusing Orders In Ukraine War
content: The men, currently on the run, recounted being tortured after declining to join assaults they believed were close to suicide missions.

title: Opinion: Opinion | How Israel Once Defied Its Biggest Ally To Help India
content: In 1971, when the world turned its back on India, Israel provided weapons when we needed them most, defying their own superpower ally.

title: Tamil Nadu Anti-Corruption Body Faces Contempt Notice In 'Cash-For-Jobs' Case
content: Days after the Madras High Court directed the state's Directorate of Vigilance and Anti-Corruption to "forthwith register a case" based on material shared by the Enforcement Directorate (ED), the issue has escalated politically ahead of the polls.

title: 6-Month-Old Baby Loses Finger During IV Drip Removal In Bengaluru, Case Filed
content: The complainant alleged that the injury caused severe pain to the child, who was immediately rushed to the emergency ward, where the wound was dressed.

title: TCS Urges Staff To Use AI Despite Risk To Revenue: CEO
content: Tata Consultancy Services is urging employees to use artificial intelligence tools to deliver work faster and cheaper, even if it eats into the company's revenue, the CEO of India's largest software-services provider said on Wednesday.

title: As PM Modi Begins Israel Trip, A Much-Awaited Defence Deal In The Works
content: As Prime Minister Narendra Modi leaves for Israel, NDTV can confirm that the next big defence deal between New Delhi and Tel Aviv is likely to be for six mid-air refuelling aircraft for the Indian Air Force.

title: Head Of France's Palace Of Versailles To Take Over Louvre: Report
content: The president of France's Palace of Versailles is expected to take over as head of the Louvre following the resignation of Laurence des Cars, an informed source told AFP on Wednesday.

title: Luxury Car Maker Aston Martin To Cut 20% Of Staff After Trump Tariffs
content: British luxury carmaker Aston Martin on Wednesday announced plans to cut up to one-fifth of its workforce after widening annual losses on US tariffs and weak Chinese demand.

title: Who Is A Designated Survivor And Why Does US Need One?
content: A cabinet official was notably absent and stayed under a special security arrangement as Donald Trump delivered his State of the Union speech today.

title: Chevron Sells Venezuelan Oil To Reliance For The 1st Time Since 2023: Report
content: US oil major Chevron has sold its first cargo of Venezuelan crude oil to Reliance Industries since December 2023, according to ship tracking data and two sources.

title: Video: Dog Carries Human Leg, Shimla Hospital Says Staff Forgot To Lock Door
content: Investigation into the shocking video of a stray dog walking around with a human leg between its jaws near a hospital in Shimla has revealed gross negligence in disposing of medical waste

content: Veena George sustains injuries to her neck and hand. The incident occurred at Kannur railway station. Minister shifted to district hospital for treatment

content: Champai Soren said his grandson suddenly fill ill and was taken to a hospital but could not be saved; Jharkhand Chief Minister Hemant Soren condoled the 19-year-oldâ€™s death

content: The accused, an overseer with Vadavucode-Puthencruz panchayat, was produced before the Muvattupuzha Vigilance Court on Wednesday

content: Coimbatore girl declared brain dead; liver, kidneys and other organs harvested under Transtan guidelines

Nallakannu, the 101-year-old veteran Communist Party of India (CPI) leader from Tamil Nadu who passed away in Chennai on February 25, 2026 following prolonged illness and age-related ailments.Â He had served as the CPI State secretary for three tenures since 1992.

title: Kerala tunnel road project: Union government grants final clearance
content: Clearance permits conversion of 17.26 hectares of forest land under Forest (Conservation) Act, 1980 for execution of Anakkampoyil-Kalladi-Meppadi tunnel road project connecting Kozhikode and Wayanad districts. title: Kings of the hot corner: Buster Olney ranks baseball's best third basemen
